sentences: Alejandro Fernández Abarca (Spanish pronunciation: [aleˈxandro feɾˈnandes aˈβaɾka]; born 24 April 1971) is a Mexican singer.
Early years =
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: His first public appearance was in 1976 in one of his father's shows.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: In 1993, he performed with his father in a concert at the Palacio de los Deportes, and he continued for a season at the Teatro Blanquita in Mexico City.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: The same year Fernández released the successful Piel de Niña, produced by Pedro Ramírez.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: At the Lo Nuestro Awards of 1993 Fernández was nominated for Male Artist, New Artist and Regional Mexican Album of the Year for his debut album, winning none.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: At the Lo Nuestro Awards of 1993 Fernández was nominated for Male Artist, New Artist and Regional Mexican Album of the Year for his debut album, winning none.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: In 1994 he released the album Grandes Éxitos a la Manera de Alejandro Fernández, singing pieces of legendary composers such as Armando Manzanero, Luis Demetrio and Agustín Lara.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

sentences: At the 9th Lo Nuestro Awards, Fernández received a nomination for Regional Mexican Male Performer of the Year.
section: == Career == | === Early years ===

== Career == | === 1999–2003: Mi Verdad, Entre Tus Brazos, Orígenes ===

sentences: With the album Mi Verdad of 1999, Fernández returned to ranchera music.
section: == Career == | === 1999–2003: Mi Verdad, Entre Tus Brazos, Orígenes ===

sentences: In 2000, he released the album Entre Tus Brazos, the eighth in his career and the second one with Emilio Estefan, Jr. as the producer.
section: == Career == | === 1999–2003: Mi Verdad, Entre Tus Brazos, Orígenes ===

sentences: That same year, he and Julio Iglesias recorded the song "Dos Corazones, Dos Historias;" it appeared on Julio's album Noche de Cuatro Lunas.
section: == Career == | === 1999–2003: Mi Verdad, Entre Tus Brazos, Orígenes ===

sentences: In 2001, he recorded Orígenes.
section: == Career == | === 1999–2003: Mi Verdad, Entre Tus Brazos, Orígenes ===

sentences: In 2002, he launched his production Un Canto De México, which contains twenty-two classic ranchera songs.
section: == Career == | === 1999–2003: Mi Verdad, Entre Tus Brazos, Orígenes ===

sentences: In 2003, Alejandro began a Latin American tour with his father Vicente, and recorded the show called "En Vivo: Juntos Por Ultima Vez", which was witnessed by thousands of fans, culminating in Mexico City at the Foro Sol, with over five hours of music in front of nearly 60,000 spectators.

sentences: On 22 November 2010, Alejandro released the live album Dos Mundos: Revolución that includes live versions of songs from his album  Dos mundos: Evolución / Dos mundos: Tradición, two unreleased tracks "Tu Sabes Quien", "Felicidades" and the song "Vamos a darnos tiempo" originally performed by the iconic singer José José.

sentences: Since his 1997 album Me Estoy Enamorando he branched out successfully into pop music.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In his live presentations, he begins the show with his ranchera repertoire, then he removes the charro outfit to sing pop songs.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He has performed with artists such as Plácido Domingo, Marc Anthony, José Carreras, Chayanne, Amaia Montero, Joan Sebastian, Gloria Estefan, Malú, Ha*Ash, Julio Iglesias, Patricia Kaas, Miguel Bosé, Mario Frangoulis, Ednita Nazario, Yuri, Franco De Vita, Diego El Cigala, Nelly Furtado, Beyoncé, Christina Aguilera, Rod Stewart, Morat, Los Tigres Del Norte, Sebastián Yatra, David Bisbal, Christian Nodal, Calibre 50, Mon Laferte as well as family members; his father Vincente Fernández, his daughter Camila Fernández, and his son Alex Fernández.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He studied to become an architect, but turned to singing in 1991 with the encouragement of his father.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In the late 1990s, Fernández's older brother Vicente, Jr. was kidnapped by a band of organized crime.
